sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Tragedy in Nepal as at least 67 people are killed in a plane crash near the city of Pokhara.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At least 67 people have died after a 72-seat passenger aircraft crashed in Nepal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Videos showed plumes of smoke billowing from the crash site as rescue workers and crowds of people gathered around the wreckage of the aircraft.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Nepalese soldiers were also involved in the rescue efforts at the crash site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The plane was flying from the capital Kathmandu to Pokhara, the gateway to the Annapurna circuit, a popular hiking trail in the Himalayas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It was not immediately clear what caused the plane to crash.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In total it was carrying 68 passengers and four crew members, according to the Kathmandu Post.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Nepal is home to eight of the world's 14 highest mountains, including Mount Everest, and has a history of air crashes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia launched a new wave of major attacks on Ukraine, hitting energy infrastructure across the country and killing at least a dozen people in a missile strike on this nine-story building in the city of Dnipro. The Ukrainian president called for more help from the international community.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Is it possible to stop the Russian terror? Yes, it is, said Volodymyr Zelensky, the president of Ukraine, calling the international community to send more weapons to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: calling the international community to send more weapons to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the northeastern Kharkiv region, the governor said two Russian missiles hit critical infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: No casualties have been reported, but emergency power cuts in the city and around were possible, the official said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Much of Ukraine is now under an emergency blackout after missiles hit power infrastructure in several cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Normally soaked in sunshine, the state of California has been swamped with devastating stormy weather this weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At least 19 people have been killed, 6,000 are under evacuation orders and 20,000 homes are without electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We're mindful of not only the moment we're in, in terms of the situational opportunities and responsibilities to protect people, to protect lives, most importantly to protect property and to make sure that we are vigilant through the next 24 to 48 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But we're also mindful we need to come back when all of you are gone, when the cameras are gone, to really talk about a more resilient future for Merced County, for the communities that have been impacted not just by this storm, but by many other storms over the course of the last many, many years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Joe Biden has announced a federal package to Sacramento, Metcred and Santa Cruz counties, with damage assessments likely to topple up to the $1 billion mark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Alexandroupoli in the north of Greece, construction is underway for a new gas-fired power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For Greece, this is a major step to increase its potential for electricity exports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For Europe, it's another means to support the continent's energy independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Greek government notes that the construction of this plant in Alexandroupoli will further enhance Europe's energy independence, as it will use liquefied natural gas that arrives in the area by ships and not by pipelines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The ceremony marking the build has been attended by Bulgaria's Minister of Energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Sofia will be the first country to import electricity from the plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We welcome very much the inauguration of this project for the construction of the gas-fired power plant as it will be able to stabilize the region and provide energy security not only for Greece but also to southeastern Europe where demand of electricity increases every year." Greece is working on necessary infrastructure that will allow it to export electricity to the wider Balkan region in the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We can provide electricity power not just to Bulgaria but also to North Macedonia, Kosovo and Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are working on building closer electricity connections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Consistent with the need for cleaner energy, the Alexandroupoli power plant will also be able to burn hydrogen to generate electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's expected to be operational by 2026.
